instruction: Develop 10 multiple choice questions about the human circulatory system
output:
Q1.What type of vessels carry oxygenated blood away from the heart?
A. Arteries
B. Venules
C. Capillaries
D. Veins

Q2. What is the innermost layer of the heart called? 
A.Ventricles
B. Myocardium
C. Endocardium
D. Epicardium

Q3. What type of blood vessels bring oxygen-rich blood to the heart?
A.Capillaries 
B. Arteries
C. Venules
D. Veins

Q4. What is the name of the organ responsible for pumping oxygen-rich blood to the body?
A.Heart
B. Kidney 
C. Lungs
D. Liver

Q5. Which of the following is not part of the circulatory system? 
A.Kidney
B. Heart
C. Skeleton
D. Lungs

Q6. What type of cell is the essential component of hemoglobin?
A. Platelets 
B. leukocytes 
C. Red blood cells 
D. White blood cells

Q7. What is the function of the valves in the human cardiovascular system?
A. To regulate the flow of blood
B. To pump oxygen
C. To provide nutrients
D. To control body temperature

Q8. What type of blood vessels carry oxygen-poor blood away from the heart?
A.Arteries 
B.Venules
C.Veins 
D.Capillaries

Q9. How many heart chambers are in the human circulatory system?
A.One 
B. Two
C. Three
D. Four

Q10.Which type of blood cell carries oxygen and gives blood its red color?
A. Platelets 
B. leukocytes 
C. White blood cells 
D. Red blood cells
